thread.title: Samantha Bee's tweet about Trump and 'A Day Without A Woman' totally nailed it
thread.title_full: Samantha Bee's tweet about Trump and 'A Day Without A Woman' totally nailed it

author: Sasha Lekach
title: Samantha Bee's tweet about Trump and 'A Day Without A Woman' totally nailed it
text:
Donald Trump does seem to enjoy being surrounded by men while he signs important documents and poses for group shots in the Oval Office.
SEE ALSO: This is the busiest man on Twitter on International Women's Day
But on International Women's Day these dude-heavy photos might come back to haunt him. Maybe because the day is also being observed as " A Day Without Women " to show how vital women are in the workforce, economy and society.
As Samantha Bee pointed out in a tweet from her Full Frontal Twitter account, Trump has no problem with the women's strike because he is so feminist. Feminist to the point where every day he keeps women out of high-level meetings and decisions. Like those about their bodies and reproductive rights.
The Trump WH is so feminist, EVERY day is Day Without a Woman. pic.twitter.com/rYZeYo04kn
— Full Frontal (@FullFrontalSamB) March 8, 2017
The image Bee used was from a meeting last week with health insurance company CEOs. There are plenty of other examples of all-guys group shots in the White House. (To be fair, Trump does include women in other meetings, but you have to search for them . And we can't forget about Kellyanne Conway .)
Great meeting with CEOs of leading U.S. health insurance companies who provide great healthcare to the American people. pic.twitter.com/KlZJH6oJub
— President Trump (@POTUS) February 27, 2017
Today I met with pharmaceutical executives at the @WhiteHouse ... https://t.co/T1L7e8pHG1 pic.twitter.com/MDr9b7rBhN
— President Trump (@POTUS) January 31, 2017
If you're wondering what patriarchy looks like: A group of white men watch as Trump reinstates the #GlobalGagRule pic.twitter.com/ZV1OX41ziF
— Jessica Valenti (@JessicaValenti) January 23, 2017
Trump's predilection for groups of men doesn't exactly help support his International Women's Day tweets about his "tremendous respect for women"in the slightest, as duly noted by Bee and her show.
WATCH: Someone has invented a waterproof toupee that looks just like real hair
